passages.text: India | Diversified Financials
Bajaj Finserv Limited
Equity Research August 28, 2025

We hosted Mr. Sanjiv Bajaj & mgmt team of Bajaj Finserv for a roadshow in the US. Mgmt targets for BFS to see customer franchise, top- line & profits grow at \(15 - 22\%\) CAGR over the next 5yrs. BALIC will target to improve margins to match peers, BAGIC aims to sustain \(15\% +\) earnings growth and healthcare/ asset mgmt/ other platforms will achieve scale. We expect BFS to grow core earnings at \(22\%\) CAGR over FY25- 28. Valuations are reasonable; retain Buy.

Life insurance: Focus on better profitability. BALIC has grown faster than peers (3yr retail APE CAGR of \(24\%\) vs \(16\%\) for pvt. peers). But, it has lagged peers on VNB margins at \(14.5\%\) in FY25 vs. avg. of \(25\%\) for peers. Mgmt aims to improve margins to \(18 - 20\%\) levels in 3yrs, for which, they have lifted fees (ULIPs), adjusted commissions, product mix, and staff targets. VNB margins for 4QFY25 & 1QFY26 were up \(\sim 4pp\) YoY. While growth may stay lower for 1- 2qtrs, uptick in premiums from agents/ banca and rise in gross agent addition will help improve growth from 2HFY26.

General insurance: Growing with higher profitability. Mgmt reiterated that BAGIC has been agile on product mix to manage profitability. Hence, its combined ratio \((102\%)\) is lower than other top 5 \((108\%)\) and sector \((117\%)\) . The key risk is increased competition in motor (esp. from PSUs), group health/ crop (from private peers), but BAGIC expects better trends in select commercial lines like fire to aid growth and profitability.

Regulatory aspects. Clarity on GST rates is awaited and basis that, insurers will be able to cut prices by \(8 - 10\%\) and hopefully, input tax credit (ITC) is allowed. It will watch out for the composite license regime and will evaluate pros & cons. Switch to IFRS & RBC will improve profits for BAGIC, and may release some capital.

New ventures. BFS is also investing in new ventures like Bajaj Asset Management, Bajaj Finserv Health, and Bajaj Finserv Direct. These are small and incurring losses due to investments. AMC has taken tad above 2yrs to build Rs300bn in AUM and as this scales up towards Rs0.8- 1tn, it will allow break- even. The healthcare business is ramping up and may engage with other insurers. The Direct platform has over 95 clients, and aspires to build other financial services, including online insurance.

Lending businesses growing well. BAF drives the majority of profits and valuation for BFS \((73\%\) of SQ). BAF, in a recent roadshow with us, pointed that SME pressure isn't as high as feared, a credit costs should be in the 185- 195bps range of loans, growth can stay healthy \((23 - 24\%)\) and NIMs can rise YoY from 4Q. Resolution on tariffs is key.

Stays as BUY: We recently initiated coverage on BFS and feel the non- lending businesses are ramping up well and can aid valuation re- rating. Succession at BAF over the next 2yrs may allow Rajeev Jain scope to engage more on businesses at BFS. Holdco discount on stake in BAF at \(17\%\) is near past avg. We rate BFS as a BUY with a SOTP- based PT of Rs2,420.
Please see analyst certifications, important disclosure information, and information regarding the status of non-US analysts on pages 9 - 14 of this report. \\* Jefferies India Private Limited

- BAF: Among India's best-run NBFCs; loan book growth outlook is strong, driven by a higher-yielding consumer durable loan book, rural financing, etc.- BAGIC: Among the most profitable GIs that has been agile at moving in/out of segments to deliver growth and profitability.- BALIC: Taking steps to improve profitability through a combination of portfolio changes, better pricing of ULIPs, more protection attachment & cost controls.- New ventures such as AMC, health platform, and direct platform can bring option values.
Risk/Reward - 12 Month View
- BAF: Loan CAGR of \(23\%\) over FY25-28E- BAGIC: GWP CAGR of \(15\%\) over the period- BALIC: APE CAGR of \(13\%\) over the period- SoTP derived PT of Rs2,420
- BAF: Loan CAGR of \(25\%\) over FY25-28E- BAGIC: GWP CAGR of \(17\%\) over the period- BALIC: APE CAGR of \(15\%\) over the period- SoTP derived PT of Rs2,780
- BAF: Loan CAGR of \(22\%\) over FY25-28E- BAGIC: GWP CAGR of \(13\%\) over the period- BALIC: APE CAGR of \(11\%\) over the period- SoTP derived PT of Rs1,720
Top Material Issues: (1) Incorporation of ESG into credit analysis. (2) Responsible Finance and (3) Lending / Selling Practices. (4) Customer Privacy & Data Security.

Company Targets: (1) Bajaj Finance plans to open financial inclusion branches in rural and backward areas. (2) Increasingly enable livelihood of individuals through products like SME lending, 3w financing, etc. Increase financing for affordable homes through housing finance subsidiary. (3) Focus on reducing consumption of papers through digital initiatives like digital agreements, digital KYC, digital communication, etc.

Questions to the Management: (1) How do you plan to participate in the +US\$12tn green funding gap in India? What is the share of company's revenues from sectors promoting socio- economic causes, and from non- metro & non- tier locations? (2) What steps is the company taking to ensure strong data security and customer privacy, given the increasing share of digital transactions? (3) What steps is the company taking to promote gender diversity at different levels? What are initiatives toward employee training/ re- skilling?

- Stronger-than-expected growth in consumer durable and rural financing business.- Further improvement in operating efficiencies and reduction in cost ratios.- Stronger-than-expected growth & profitability in BAGIC led by easing competition due to EOM norms.- Quicker-than-expected improvement in BALIC.- Rapid scale-up of new ventures like AMC, health platform & more.

Digital first Health Tech company providing differentiated products & services on a digital platform to all Payers like Insurers, Corporates, Government and more, through bilateral network arrangement with all Providers. Cover Wellness, Outpatient (OPD) and inpatient (IPD) services, thus providing Continuum of care
Source: Company data, Jefferies

Deep and wide network• 120,000+ Doctors on platform, with 9000+ Hospital doctors; 4000+ lab touch points• 15,000+ Hospitals, including 2400+ Hospitals for Cashless OPDDiversified Product Mix• Differentiated product plans for retail and corporate customers• Integrated OPD+ IPD product offeringOperational efficiency• Annual servicing of over 4.5 MM OPD transactions &amp; over 130 MM lives in IPD• Over 600 Doctors for claim adjudicationTechnology and Data Analytics• Comprehensive digital journey for Cashless healthcare transactions• App first approach with Microservice scalable architecture• Artificial Intelligence (AI) led Abuse management services

We would like to thank Aditya Nevrekar, employee of Evaluaserve Inc., for providing research support services to our preparation of this report.

Bajaj Finserv is an Indian financial services company and the holding company for the Bajaj Group's financial businesses. Its primary business is to provide a wide range of financial solutions through its subsidiaries. BFS operations are divided into three main segments: lending (through its subsidiary Bajaj Finance), life insurance (through Bajaj Allianz Life Insurance), and general insurance (through Bajaj Allianz General Insurance). The company also provides asset management and healthcare- related services, offering a comprehensive suite of financial products and services.

We value Bajaj Finserv on a SOTP basis, arriving at a PT of Rs2,420; core lending business (BAF) with standalone entity is valued at 5x Sep- 27E P/BV, BAGIC at 33x Sep- 27 P/E, BALIC using appraisal value method at 12x Sep- 27 P/VNB + 1x Sep- 27 P/EV, and AMC using P/AUM method at 4%. Risks arise from aggressive expansion by Jio FS and competition from PSUs for BAGIC.

Our PT of Rs1,100 is based on SoTP valuation. Standalone entity is valued at 5x Sep- 27E P/BV. Key risks to our valuation include slowdown in growth, higher- than- expected NIM compression, and asset quality deterioration. Upside risks include stronger- than- expected growth in consumer durable and rural financing business and further improvement in operating efficiencies and reduction in cost ratios.
(Article 3(1)e and Article 7 of MAR) Recommendation Published Recommendation Distributed

Buy - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of \(15\%\) or more within a 12- month period. Hold - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of plus \(15\%\) or minus \(10\%\) within a 12- month period. Underperform - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of minus \(10\%\) or less within a 12- month period. The expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) for Buy rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) or more within a 12- month period as these companies are typically more volatile than the overall stock market. For Hold rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is plus or minus \(20\%\) within a 12- month period. For Underperform rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is minus \(20\%\) or less within a 12- month period.
NR - The investment rating and price target have been temporarily suspended. Such suspensions are in compliance with applicable regulations and/or Jefferies policies.
CS - Coverage Suspended. Jefferies has suspended coverage of this company.
NC - Not covered. Jefferies does not cover this company.

Restricted - Describes issuers where, in conjunction with Jefferies engagement in certain transactions, company policy or applicable securities regulations prohibit certain types of communications, including investment recommendations.
Monitor - Describes securities whose company fundamentals and financials are being monitored, and for which no financial projections or opinions on the investment merits of the company are provided.

Jefferies methodology for assigning ratings may include the following: market capitalization, maturity, growth/value, volatility and expected total return over the next 12 months. The price targets are based on several methodologies, which may include, but are not restricted to, analyses of market risk, growth rate, revenue stream, discounted cash flow (DCF), EBITDA, EPS, cash flow (CF), free cash flow (FCF), EV/EBITDA, P/E, PE/growth, P/CF, P/FCF, premium (discount)/average group EV/EBITDA, premium (discount)/average group P/E, sum of the parts, net asset value, dividend returns, and return on equity (ROE) over the next 12 months.

Jefferies Franchise Picks include stock selections from among the best stock ideas from our equity analysts over a 12 month period. Stock selection is based on fundamental analysis and may take into account other factors such as analyst conviction, differentiated analysis, a favorable risk/reward ratio and investment themes that Jefferies analysts are recommending. Jefferies Franchise Picks will include only Buy rated stocks and the number can vary depending on analyst recommendations for inclusion. Stocks will be added as new opportunities arise and removed when the reason for inclusion changes, the stock has met its desired return, if it is no longer rated Buy and/or if it triggers a stop loss. Stocks having 120 day volatility in the bottom quartile of S&P stocks will continue to have a \(15\%\) stop loss, and the remainder will have a \(20\%\) stop. Franchise Picks are not intended to represent a recommended portfolio of stocks and is not sector based, but we may note where we believe a Pick falls within an investment style such as growth or value.
- Bajaj Finance Limited (BAF IN: INR876.50, BUY)- Bajaj Finserv Limited (BJFIN IN: INR1,927.00, BUY)
